briefdescription.para: Index used with formatValue() for formatting default value if set.
Flags for the option.
Minimum number of values required (in one set).
Maximum allowed number of values (in one set), or -1 if no limit.
Whether we are currently assigning values to a set.
Whether there were errors in set values.
Returns true if the option has been set.
Returns true if the option is a boolean option.

detaileddescription.para: This is used to optionally support an alternative syntax where an option provided with no value sets the value to true and an option prefixed with "no" clears the value.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the option is a hidden option.
Returns true if the option is required.
Returns true if the option is vector-valued.
Returns the name of the option.
Returns the description of the option set by the calling code.
Returns true if defaultValueIfSet() value is specified.
Returns the minimum number of values required in one set.
Returns the maximum allowed number of values in one set (-1 = no limit).
Returns an option info object corresponding to this option.
Returns a short string describing the type of the option.
Formats additional description for the option.

detaileddescription.para: If this method returns a non-empty string, it is appended to the plain description when printing help texts. The default implementation returns an empty string.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of option values added so far.
Returns the i'th value formatted as a string.

detaileddescription.para: If i is DefaultValueIfSetIndex, should format the default value if set (see OptionTemplate::defaultValueIfSet()).

briefdescription.para: Returns the default value if set for the option as a string.
Starts adding values from a new source for the option.

detaileddescription.para: This marks the vurrent value of the option as a default value, causing next call to startSet() to clear it. This allows values from the new source to overwrite old values.
This method does not throw.

briefdescription.para: Starts adding a new set of values for the option.

detaileddescription.para:
InvalidInputError
if option is specified multiple times, but is not specified to accept it.
If the parameter is specified multiple times, startSet() should be called before the values for each instance.
Strong exception safety guarantee.

briefdescription.para: Adds a new value for the option, converting it from a string.

detaileddescription.para:
value
String value to convert.
InvalidInputError
if value cannot be converted, or if there are too many values.
This method should only be called between startSet() and finishSet().

briefdescription.para: Performs validation and/or actions once a set of values has been added.

detaileddescription.para:
InvalidInputError
if too few values have been provided, or if the valid values since previous startSet() are invalid as a set.
If the parameter is specified multiple times, finishSet() should be called after the values for each instance.

briefdescription.para: Performs validation and/or actions once all values have been added.

detaileddescription.para:
InvalidInputError
if the option is required but not set, or if all valid values together are invalid as a set.
This method should be called after all values have been provided with appendValue().

briefdescription.para: Initializes the storage object from the settings object.

parameterdescription.para: Option flags that are always set and specify generic behavior of the option.
if invalid settings have been provided.

briefdescription.para: Marks the option as set.
Returns true if the given flag is set.
Sets the given flag.
Clears the given flag.
Sets a new minimum number of values required in one set.

detaileddescription.para:
count
New minimum number of values (must be > 0).
InvalidInputError
if already provided values violate the limit.
If values have already been provided, it is checked that there are enough.
Cannot be called for options with efOption_MultipleTimes set, because it is impossible to check the requirement after the values have been set. If attempted, will assert.

briefdescription.para: Sets a new maximum number of values required in one set.

detaileddescription.para:
count
New maximum number of values (must be > 0, or -1 for no limit).
InvalidInputError
if already provided values violate the limit.
If values have already been provided, it is checked that there are not too many.
Cannot be called for options with efOption_MultipleTimes set, because it is impossible to check the requirement after the values have been set. If attempted, will assert.

briefdescription.para: Removes all values from temporary storage for a set.

detaileddescription.para: This function is always called before starting to add values to a set, allowing the storage to clear its internal buffers.
Should not throw.

briefdescription.para: Adds a new value, converting it from a string.

detaileddescription.para:
value
String value to convert.
InvalidInputError
if value is not valid for this option or if there have been too many values in the set.
This method may be called multiple times if the underlying option is defined to accept multiple values.

briefdescription.para: Performs validation and/or actions once a set of values has been added.

detaileddescription.para:
InvalidInputError
if the values in the set are not valid as a whole.
This method may be called multiple times if the underlying option can be specified multiple times. This method is not currently called if one of the convertValue() calls throwed.

briefdescription.para: Performs validation and/or actions once all values have been added.

detaileddescription.para:
InvalidInputError
if all provided values are not valid as a set.
This method is always called once.

If the method throws, implementation should take care to leave the option in a consistent, meaningful state. However, currently none of the implementations actually throw in any situation where the option may be left in an inconsistent state.

briefdescription.para: Abstract base class for converting, validating, and storing option values.

detaileddescription.para: This class should normally not be subclassed directly, but the OptionStorageTemplate should be used instead. The templated class provides basic functionality for most of the pure virtual methods, and also integrates well with option setting objects derived from OptionTemplate.

internal.para:
This class really consists of two parts: the public interface that is used by the internal implementation of the options module, and the interface that derived classes use to provide type-dependent functionality. The latter consists of a few pure virtual methods, of which a few simple query methods are also part of the module-internal interface, others are protected and called by the non-virtual methods when needed. The reason why these two roles are in one class is twofold:
Both the derived classes and the internal module implementation may need access to the same information like the allowed number of values and the name of the option.
Having only one class is consistent with the structure used for options settings objects: there is very direct correspondence between AbstractOption and AbstractOptionStorage and between OptionTemplate and OptionStorageTemplate.
